intro: Moraea acocksii, commonly known as the Acocks' moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces its showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
